thread.title: Domino’s pizza delivery driver leaves note offering 'weed, MDMA, pills, ket & much more' | Metro News
thread.title_full: Domino’s pizza delivery driver leaves note offering 'weed, MDMA, pills, ket & much more' | Metro News

author: Richard Hartley-Parkinson For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Domino’s pizza delivery driver leaves note offering 'weed, MDMA, pills, ket & much more' | Metro News
text:
Richard Hartley-Parkinson for Metro.co.uk Thursday 16 Feb 2017 11:22 am A pizza delivery driver offered some extra services (Picture: Liverpool Echo) 
When we order pizza we like it with a side of chips, maybe some onion rings and a bottle of lemonade. 
But in Liverpool, it looks like they offer far more. 
A customer got the note above offering a host of drugs offering a round-the-clock service. 
They contacted police who have been looking into the note while the delivery driver has been suspended. 
One of the people who wrote to the Liverpool Echo about the incident said that he had been offered viagra with his Indian takeaway. 
The note was hidden in their pizza box (Picture: Liverpool Echo) 
Another comlpained that you ‘wouldn’t get that from your local chippy’ 
A police spokesman said: ‘Merseyside Police is investigating an incident of suspicious circumstances at an address in Liverpool City Centre on Friday, 10 February. 
‘At around 9.40pm, a report was received of a pizza delivery driver attending at a premises in Seymour Street. Food was delivered and a note was allegedly left offering drugs for sale, including phone numbers.’ 
Domino’s spokesman Nina Arnott said: ‘We have suspended the individual in question whilst we investigate this issue in conjunction with Merseyside Police.’ More
